From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From tortura +‎ -ar.

Verb

[edit]

torturar (first-person singular indicative present torturo, past participle torturáu)

  1. to torture (to intentionally inflict unnecessary pain or suffering on helpless victims)

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of torturar
infinitive torturar
gerund torturando
past participle m torturáu, f torturada, n torturao, m pl torturaos, f pl torturaes
person first singular
yo 		second singular
tu 		third singular
él/elli 		first plural
nosotros/nós 		second plural
vosotros/vós 		third plural
ellos
indicative present torturo tortures tortura torturamos torturáis torturen
imperfect torturaba torturabes torturaba torturábemos, torturábamos torturabeis, torturabais torturaben
preterite torturé torturasti, torturesti torturó torturemos torturastis, torturestis torturaron
pluperfect torturare, torturara torturares, torturaras torturare, torturara torturáremos, torturáramos torturareis, torturarais torturaren, torturaran
future torturaré torturarás torturará torturaremos torturaréis torturarán
conditional torturaría torturaríes torturaría torturaríemos, torturaríamos torturaríeis, torturaríais torturaríen
subjunctive present torture tortures, torturas torture torturemos torturéis torturen, torturan
imperfect torturare, torturara torturares, torturaras torturare, torturara torturáremos, torturáramos torturareis, torturarais torturaren, torturaran
imperative — tortura — — torturái —

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From tortura +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [tur.tuˈɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [tor.tuˈɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [toɾ.tuˈɾaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

torturar (first-person singular present torturo, first-person singular preterite torturí, past participle torturat)

  1. to torture

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of torturar (first conjugation)

gerund torturant
past participle masculine feminine
singular torturat torturada
plural torturats torturades
person singular plural
first second third first second third

vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles

preterite torturí torturares torturà torturàrem torturàreu torturaren
conditional torturaria torturaries torturaria torturaríem torturaríeu torturarien

vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres

negative (no) — no torturis no torturi no torturem no tortureu no torturin

Derived terms

[edit]
  • torturador

Further reading

[edit]
  • “torturar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “torturar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “torturar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “torturar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

From tortura +‎ -ar.

Verb

[edit]

torturar (first-person singular present torturo, first-person singular preterite torturei, past participle torturado)

  1. to torture (to intentionally inflict unnecessary pain or suffering on helpless victims)

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From tortura (“torture”) +‎ -ar, from Latin tortūra (“twisting; torture”), from torqueō (“to twist”), from Proto-Indo-European *terkʷ- (“to turn”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /toʁ.tuˈɾa(ʁ)/ [toh.tuˈɾa(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /toʁ.tuˈɾa(ʁ)/ [toh.tuˈɾa(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /toɾ.tuˈɾa(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /toʁ.tuˈɾa(ʁ)/ [toχ.tuˈɾa(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /toɻ.tuˈɾa(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /tuɾ.tuˈɾaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /tuɾ.tuˈɾaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /tuɾ.tuˈɾa.ɾi/

  • Hyphenation: tor‧tu‧rar

Verb

[edit]

torturar (first-person singular present torturo, first-person singular preterite torturei, past participle torturado)

  1. to torture (to intentionally inflict unnecessary pain or suffering on helpless victims)
    Synonyms: afligir, atormentar, supliciar
  2. (figurative) to cause angst
    Synonym: angustiar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of torturar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)

Negative (não) não tortures não torture não torturemos não tortureis não torturem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Derived terms

[edit]
  • torturado
  • torturador
  • torturante

Further reading

[edit]
  • “torturar”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From tortura +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /toɾtuˈɾaɾ/ [t̪oɾ.t̪uˈɾaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: tor‧tu‧rar

Verb

[edit]

torturar (first-person singular present torturo, first-person singular preterite torturé, past participle torturado)

  1. (transitive) to torture

Conjugation

[edit]

gerund torturando
past participle masculine feminine
singular torturado torturada
plural torturados torturadas
